summary: The term race or racial group refers to dividing the human species according to physical characteristics that are inherited.
full_text: Social interpretations of race regard the common categorizations of people into different races, often with biologist tagging of particular "racial" attributes beyond mere anatomy, as more socially and culturally determined than based upon biology. Such interpretations are often deconstructionist and poststructuralist in that they critically analyze the historical construction and development of racial categories.
title: Race (sociology)
